instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2179: What is A2179? A2179 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2020 with EMC 3302, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01958..
definitions.820-01958: What is 820-01958? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V 0.37A seems to be turning on but no <SIGNAL>PPVCC_CPU</SIGNAL> lines - Cola spill
threads.message:
Hi guys,

I have this <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, which had a cola spill, melted USBC connector and trackpad connector on the trackpad side.
Replaced USBc connector on the board and socket; <RESISTOR>R6960</RESISTOR> was severely corroded, I replaced it and now can power it on. 20V 0.37A but not getting any capslock, USB activity, or screen.

CPU is heating up, actually the whole board is reaching 34*C on a 20* day here. Also there is slight ticking noise from the board, but cant pinpoint the location.

Tried with both disconnected trackpad only and cable from the board to KBD/Tpad.

Which voltages should I report?
Coil voltage seems ok apart than these, which seem missing (or inaccurate?):

<SIGNAL>PPVCC_CPU_PH1</SIGNAL> - 0V
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_CPU_PH2</SIGNAL> - 0V
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_CPU_PH3</SIGNAL> - 0V
<SIGNAL>VCCINAUX_SW</SIGNAL> - 1.81V

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V 0.37A seems to be turning on but no <SIGNAL>PPVCC_CPU</SIGNAL> lines - Cola spill
threads.message:
Possibly T2, or CPU damage.
Check if is detected in DFU mode.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20V 0.37A seems to be turning on but no <SIGNAL>PPVCC_CPU</SIGNAL> lines - Cola spill
threads.message: No picking up anything in DFU mode, so dead CPU/T2 it is, I guess.
